title: Bartz v Anthropic
headline: Bartz v Anthropic - settlement (~$1.5B) and prior fair-use/train vs piracy distinction.
summary:
Summaries: Bartz v Anthropic — Proposed global settlement reported around $1.5B covering ~500,000 works (~$3,000/work), following Judge Alsup’s earlier ruling distinguishing training (potentially fair use) from mass pirated acquisition (not fair use).

Key takeaway: Even if training is fair use, acquisition via piracy/torrents can still create liability.

title: Kadrey et al. v Meta
headline: Kadrey et al. v Meta - N.D. Cal rules AI training fair use (on record presented).
summary:
Summaries: Kadrey et al. v Meta — Summary judgment found training on books to be fair use on the case record, but noted market harm pleadings could matter in other circumstances; ongoing disputes include issues around acquisition/torrenting context.

Key takeaway: Future pleadings that prove harm to the market for original works may fare better than focusing on a separate training-license market.
